data.name: LblAFUseBrightestStarsTooltip
data.value: Автофокус по ярчайшим звездам. 0 - без ограничений.

data.name: LblAltitudeMeasurementButtonTooltip
data.value: Изменение ошибки высоты в три шага. 1. Получите снимок и определите его координаты при данном положении 2. Переместите телескоп по прямому восхождению на 0.5 градуса 3. Получите ещё снимок и определите его координаты для текущего положения Ошибка высоты вычисляется из этих двух координат и отображается

data.name: LblAltitudeMeasurementDescription
data.value: Направьте телескоп на восток или запад, точку со склонением 0 и у горизонта.

data.name: LblAnnotateImageTooltip
data.value: Если выбран и проведен поиск звезд, найденные звезды будут подписаны на изображении и их HFR будут отображены

data.name: LblApplicationInBreakMode
data.value: Приложение столкнулось с необработанным исключением и, скорее всего, должно быть закрыто. Ошибка записана в "%localappdata%\NINA\Logs". Должно ли приложение попытаться восстановиться после ошибки? (Может привести к неожиданному поведению)

data.name: LblApplicationStartDateDescription
data.value: Дата начала приложения в формате ГГГГ-ММ-ДД

data.name: LblAscomInterOpDriverException
data.value: Возниклаисключение при взаимодействии с драйвером ASCOM. Скорее всего, это вызвано несоответствием между драйвером, устанавливаемым как {0}, и в N.I.N.A. {1}. Пожалуйста, установите драйвер как {1}

data.name: LblASIImageDownloadError
data.value: Ошибка получения данных изображения из камеры!

data.name: LblASTAP
data.value: ASTAP, Программа астрометрического сложения, определитель астрометрических координат и просмотрщик FITS

data.name: LblASTAPMinimumVersionNote
data.value: Примечание: Требуется ASTAP версии 0.9.192 или выше. Для более ранних версий используйте ASTAP как замену Platesolve2.

data.name: LblAutoFocusExposureTimeTooltip
data.value: Время экспозиции, используемое для автофокусировки, когда время для данного фильтра не установлено или равно нулю

data.name: LblAutoFocusGearNotConnected
data.value: Не могу начать автофокусировку. Камера или фокусер не подсоединены!

data.name: LblAutoFocusInnerCropRatioTooltip
data.value: If set to a value less than one, star detection during autofocus will only use a centered subframe of the total sensor (if supported by camera). If unsupported by the camera, stars near the edge will be ignored during star detection. If used in combination with a lower than 1 Outer Crop Ratio, a rectangular sliver of the image (between the inner rectangle and the outer rectangle) will be used for autofocus.

data.name: LblAutoFocusMethodTooltip
data.value: When Star HFR is selected, NINA will detect stars in the FOV, compute their HFR across multiple focus points, and find the minimum HFR. The Contrast Detection method uses image processing techniques to estimate contrast across multiple focus points, and finds the highest contrast. This method works on terrestrial objects or solar system objects as well, but can be sensitive to noise.

data.name: LblAutoFocusNewWorseThanOriginal
data.value: New focus point HFR {0} is significantly worse than original HFR {1}

data.name: LblAutoFocusNotEnoughtSpreadedPoints
data.value: Not enough HFR difference for set of focuspoints. Either the step size is too low or the stars are too much out of focus.

data.name: LblAutoFocusNumberOfAttemptsTooltip
data.value: If autofocus fails because it got worse HFR than original focus, how many times to reattempt autofocus routine until it is either successful or it moves back to original focus position.

data.name: LblAutoFocusNumberOfFramesPerPoint
data.value: AF Number of Frames per Point

data.name: LblAutoFocusNumberOfFramesPerPointTooltip
data.value: How many frames to take for each focus point. If greater than one, multiple frames will be taken for a focus point, and their HFR will be averaged to compute focus point HFR

data.name: LblAutoStretchFactorTooltip
data.value: Коэффициент алгоритма авторастяжения гистограммы используется для показа изображения и обнаружения звезд. Допустимы значения от 0 до 1. Значение 0.2 подходит в большинстве случаев.

data.name: LblAzimuthMeasurementButtonTooltip
data.value: Измерение ошибки азимута в три шага. 1. Сделайте снимок в текущем положении и определите координаты 2. Сместите телескоп по прямому восхождению на 0.5 градуса 3. Сделайте снимок в новом положении, определите координаты Ошибка азимута будет вычислена с использованием двух определений координат и показана на экране

data.name: LblAzimuthMeasurementDescription
data.value: Направьте телескоп в сторону юга вблизи склонения равного 0 и рядом с меридианом

data.name: LblBacklashMeasurementException
data.value: При измерении люфта произошла ошибка. Значение люфта может быть неверным.

data.name: LblBacklashMeasurements
data.value: Следующие значения люфта фокусера будут сохранены. Внутрь: {0}, Наружу: {1}

data.name: LblBlindSolveAttemptForFraming
LblCameraConnectionLost
data.value: Соединение с камерой потеряно! Подключите камеру!

data.name: LblCameraCoolerNotEnabled
data.value: Камера имеет охлаждение, но оно ещё не включено

data.name: LblCameraDownloadFailed
LblCameraHighPower
data.value: Охладитель камеры работает на {0}% мощности и возможно не сможет компенсировать изменение температуры окружающей среды

data.name: LblChangedSequenceWarning
data.value:
The sequence for the target(s) '{0}' have been modified since it was last saved (or has not been saved yet).
Do you want to close the sequence and lose the changes anyway?

data.name: LblChangeToBulbMode
data.value: Please change the mode dial to bulb mode

data.name: LblChangeToManualMode
data.value: Please change the mode dial to manual mode

data.name: LblChecksumError
data.value: Checksum does not match expected value. Downloaded file may be corrupted!

data.name: LblColorSensorNotSupported
data.value: Color sensor is not supported yet

data.name: LblCoolCamBtnTooltip
data.value: Turns the cooler on and cools the camera to the given target temperature. A duration is optional. Most camera drivers already regulate the cooler power automatically and will only gradually decrease the temperature. In case a longer duration is needed, a duration can be specified and the application will slowly lower the target temperature of the camera based on the given duration.

data.name: LblCoverScopeMsgBox
data.value: Cover your scope now and press OK to start taking the dark flats.

data.name: LblDARVSlewButtonTooltip
data.value: Будет сделана экспозиция при медленном движении телескопа в сторону и обратно, если линии не совмещены, то имеется ошибка установки полярной оси

data.name: LblDARVSlewDescription
data.value: Укажите длительность процедуры D.A.R.V. Половину этого времени телескоп перемещается в одну сторону по RA и затем возвращается назад. Если отсутствует ошибка установки полярной оси, будет нарисована прямая линия. Если ошибка есть - будет нарисована V-образная линия. Для измерения ошибки азимута направьте телескоп примерно на меридиан, для ошибки высоты - на восток или запад.

data.name: LblDateFormatDescription2
data.value: Дата сдвинута назад на 12 часов с форматом ГГГГ-ММ-ДД

data.name: LblDebayeredHFRTooltip
data.value: Дебайеризуйте изображение для вычисления HFR. Это более точно, но требует больше вычислений.

data.name: LblDebayerImageTooltip
data.value: Дебайеризация для предварительного просмотра (сохраняемый файл не изменяется)

data.name: LblDefaultSequenceFolder
data.value: Папка по умолчанию для серии изображений

data.name: LblDefaultSequenceFolderTooltip
data.value: Серии снимков будут загружены из и сохранены в указанную здесь папку

data.name: LblDeleteProfileInUseWarning
data.value: Невозможно удалить профиль. Он уже используется другим экземпляром N.I.N.A!

data.name: LblDirectGuiderConnectionFail
data.value: Прямой гид не смог подключиться к телескопу

data.name: LblDirectGuiderTelescopeDisconnect
data.value: Телескоп был отключен. Прямое гидирование отключено. Дизеринг больше не производится!

data.name: LblDirectoryNotFound
data.value: Каталог для сохранения изображения не найден!

data.name: LblDirectoryNotWritable
data.value: Папка для сохранения изображений не имеет прав на запись!

data.name: LblDitherOnButGuiderNotConnected
data.value: Dithering включен, но гид не подключен

data.name: LblDomeASCOMConnectFailed
data.value: Unable to connect to ASCOM Dome driver:

data.name: LblDownloadImageTooltip
data.value: Download Image from the NASA skysurvey for the given coordinates

data.name: LblEDCameraNotInManualMode
data.value: Camera is not set to manual or bulb mode! Please set it to manual or bulb mode before connecting

data.name: LblEnableBitScalingTooltip
data.value: Save 10/12/14 bit images with scaling to 16 bits. (Only relevant for Altair and ToupTek cameras)

data.name: LblExposureCalculatorDescription
data.value: This tool will suggest a recommended exposure time based on the read noise from your sensor and the average skyglow. If you have SharpCap installed and perform a Sensor Analysis, then use the drop down below to retrieve the read noise and full well capacity for the specified gain. You can also calculate the bias by clicking the Snapshot button next to Bias Mean.

data.name: LblExposureCalculatorMeanLessThanOffset
data.value: Unable to determine exposure time recommendation. The mean of your current image is less than the specified bias mean. Please take a longer exposure or adjust the incorrect values.

data.name: LblFileCameraDescription
data.value: This simulated camera will enable the use of cameras which lack an SDK, while still using the whole N.I.N.A. workflow. This simulated camera will watch the specified folder for newly created files. These files will be stored inside an internal queue. Each time the application wants to download an exposure from the camera, the first item of this file queue is resolved and loaded into N.I.N.A. Additionally a manual Bulb Mode trigger can be activated, so it will use the selected Bulb Mode in Settings->Equipment->Camera on Exposure Start. When this trigger is deactivated the application will just skip the Start Exposure and just wait for another file to roll into the specified folder

data.name: LblFilterNotFoundForPosition
data.value: No filter found at position {0}. Please re-evaluate the filters inside the setting, that they correspond your filter wheel!

data.name: LblFilterSetButFilterWheelNotConnected
data.value: One or more sequence items have a filter set, but filter wheel is not connected

data.name: LblFilterwheelConnectionLost
data.value: Filterwheel connection lost! Please reconnect filterwheel!

data.name: LblFlatDeviceConnectedButCoverNotOpen
data.value: Флетбокс подключен, но крышка не открыта.

data.name: LblFlatDeviceOpenForDarkFlats
data.value: Open cover for dark flats in flat wizard

data.name: LblFlatExposureCalcContinue
data.value: Среднее значение в единицах АЦП было {0}, начинаем определение экспозиции с {1}

data.name: LblFlatSequenceCancelled
data.value: Съёмка флетов отменена, не удалось определить выдержку для флетов

data.name: LblFlatUserPromptFailure
data.value: Не удалось получить подходящую экспозицию флетов

data.name: LblFlatUserPromptFlatTooBright
data.value: Ваш флет слишком ярок, снизьте яркость, настройте допуск, среднее значение яркости или минимальную допустимую выдержку

data.name: LblFlatUserPromptFlatTooDim
data.value: Ваши флеты слишком темные, увеличьте яркость, настройте допуск, целевое значение или максимальную допустимую выдержку

data.name: LblFocuserAutoFocusInitialOffsetStepsTooltip
data.value: Initial amount of steps the focuser will move out to begin auto focus procedure.

data.name: LblFocuserAutoFocusStepSizeTooltip
data.value: The size of one focus step used for auto focusing. One step should be less than the critical focus point tolerance

data.name: LblFocuserBacklashTooltip
data.value: Inwards and outwards focuser backlash, in focuser steps

data.name: LblFocuserConnectionLost
data.value: Focuser connection lost! Please reconnect focuser!

data.name: LblFocuserSettleTimeTooltip
data.value: If the focuser introduces image shift when moving, set a settle time in seconds here.

data.name: LblFocuserUseFilterWheelOffsetsTooltip
data.value: When switching from one filter to another the focuser will change it's position relative to the given offset specified for that filter

data.name: LblFocusPointValidationFailed
LblGPSConnectFail

data.value: Import location using an NMEA GPS device

data.value: Guider Dither is enabled, but application is not connected to Guider

data.name: LblGuiderNoResume
data.value: Guider did not send resume message in time. Sequence will resume, but make sure Guider is guiding again!

data.name: LblGuiderNoSettleDone
data.value: Guider did not send SettleDone message in time. Skipping.

data.name: LblHistogramResolutionTooltip

data.name: LblImageTypeDescription
data.value: Лайт, Флет, Дарк, Биас и Снимок

data.name: LblLblBlackClippingTooltip
data.value: Black clipping factor in sigma units from the median

data.value: Download Image from file and use the blindsolver to determine coordinates

data.name: LblLoadProfileInUseWarning

data.name: LblManualFilterWheelDescription

data.name: LblManualRotatorDescription
data.value: When rotation is requested a notification will pop up to rotate manually

data.name: LblMinExposureTimeDownloadRatio
data.value: Minimum Exposure Time from Download Ratio

data.value: New update is available ({0})! Do you want to update now?

data.value: No Nikon camera could be found

data.value: No coordinates available to sync telescope to

data.value: There are no options for this file format

data.name: LblNoiseReductionTooltip
data.value: Noise Reduction applied prior to star detection. This may help with noisy images and short exposures.

data.name: LblNoSyncTooltip
data.value: When enabled the application will never send a sync command to the telescope. This should only be used when having a good pointing model that should not be altered in any way.

data.name: LblObjectType_G+C+N
data.value: Cluster with Nebulosity in a Galaxy

data.value: Cluster with Nebulosity in the LMC

data.value: Cluster with Nebulosity in the SMC

data.name: LblOpenWeatherMapClientDescription
data.value: Uses OpenWeatherMap's Current Weather API. Weather data is refreshed every 10 minutes.

data.value: Telescope is set to park at sequence end, yet it is unable to do so

data.name: LblParkEnabledButTelescopeNotConnected
data.value: Telescope is set to park at sequence end, yet it is not connected

data.name: LblSensorAnalysisPoorFit
data.value: Sensor Analysis is irregular, and may not produce accurate results. Consider re-running it.

data.name: LblSequenceCommandAtCompletionTooltip
data.value: Select command to run when sequence completes.

data.name: LblSequenceTemplateTooltip
data.value: Specifies a path to a previously exported sequence file that should be used as a template. This template will be used on startup to initialize the sequence instead of the default one.

data.name: LblSetAutoFocusFilterTooltip
data.value: If set, auto-focus will always use the selected filter, using filter wheel offsets

data.name: LblSetParkToolTip
data.value: Sets the park position to be the current position

data.name: LblAutoRetryStartGuidingTooltip
data.value: Attempt to recover StartGuiding command if the guider does not report it is guiding after the specified amount of time.

data.name: LblAutoRetryStartGuidingTimeoutTooltip
data.value: Timeout in seconds before abandoning a StartGuiding command before attempting to a retry.

data.name: LblSharpCapSensorAnalysisPathTooltip
data.value: Folder where SharpCap Sensor Analysis files can be found, if somewhere other than their default location

data.name: LblSlewEnabledButTelescopeNotConnected
data.value: Slew to target is enabled, yet telescope is not connected

data.value: At least one target with slew enabled has no target coordinates set

data.name: LblStarSensitivityTooltip
data.value: Determines sensitivity of star detection algorithm. Higher settings may mistakenly detect noise, and may take more time

data.name: LblStartBacklashMeasurementConfirmation
data.value: Backlash Measurement will start now. Before proceeding, please confirm your system is currently at or close to good focus

data.value: Save current targets as a set

data.name: LblUnlinkedStretchTooltip
data.value: When enabled, color channels will be stretched separately, helping hide the sky background and enhancing autofocus and platesolving reliablity, especially in light polluted areas. Processing time is however increased.

data.name: LblUPBV2InvalidResponse
data.value: Invalid response from Pegasus Astro Ultimate Powerbox V2.

data.name: LblBayerPatternTooltip
data.value: The Bayer pattern to be used for the BAYERPAT keyword in the FITS or XISF image headers for images generated by color sensors. The default of Auto uses any pattern that the camera driver might provide. Does not apply to DSLR cameras.

data.name: LblCameraTimeout
data.value: Camera Timeout - Camera did not set image as ready after exposuretime + {0} seconds

data.name: LblUnknownEpochWarning
data.value: The mount operates using an unknown equatorial reference system. {0} will be used. Please configure the mount's driver with a valid epoch.

data.name: LblUnsupportedEpoch
data.value: The mount operates using the {0} equatorial reference system, which is not supported.

data.name: LblLowDiskSpaceForSequence
data.value: Available space on drive {0} may be insufficient. The estimated disk space required for the sequence is {1}, but only {2} remains.

data.name: LblAbsolute
data.comment: Focuser Backlash Compensation Method to add an absolute value after a focuser direction change

data.name: LblFocuserBacklashMethodTooltip
data.value:
This controls the backlash compensation method used.
Absolute: When the focuser changes directions, an absolute value will be added to the focuser movement. Backlash IN: when the focuser changes from moving outwards to moving inwards the Backlash IN value will be added Backlash OUT: when the focuser changes from moving inwards to moving outwards the Backlash OUT value will be added
Overshoot: This method will compensate for Backlash by overshooting the target position by a large amount and then moving the focuser back to the initially requested position. Due to this compensation the last movement of the focuser will always be in the same direction (either always inwards or always outwards) For Backlash IN and OUT only ONE of these two must be set! When setting IN, the amount will be applied on each inward movement, so the final movement will always be outwards. For Backlash OUT, it will be the other way around.
The method can only be changed when the focuser is not connected!

data.name: LblOvershoot
data.comment: Focuser Backlash Compensation Method by overshooting the position and moving back

data.name: LblFocuserMoveLargeTooltip
data.value: Moves focuser by a large amount using five times the Autofocus Stepsize

data.name: LblFocuserMoveSmallTooltip
data.value: Moves focuser by a small amount using half the Autofocus Stepsize

data.name: LblMoveFocuserTooltip
data.value: Moves focuser to the specified target position

data.name: LblMoveRotatorTooltip
data.value: Moves rotator to the specified target position

data.name: LblIncompatibleGainsInSequence
data.value: Sequence contains items using incompatible Gain settings. These will be ignored!

data.name: LblIncompatibleOffsetsInSequence
data.value: Sequence cotains items using incompatible Offset settings. These will be ignored!

data.name: LblFlatDeviceAreYouSureBinning
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete all values for binning

data.name: LblFlatDeviceAreYouSureGain
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete all values for gain

data.name: LblCouldNotReachTargetTemperature
data.value: Camera is unable to reach the specified target temperature!

data.name: LblWaitingToTurnCoolerOff
data.value: Camera waiting to turn cooler off

data.name: LblWarmCamBtnTooltip
data.value: Warms the camera back to ambient temperature and turns the cooler off. A duration is optional. Most camera drivers already regulate the cooler power automatically and will only gradually increase the temperature. In case a longer duration is needed, a duration can be specified and the application will slowly raise the target temperature of the camera based on the given duration.

data.name: LblHighGainModeTooltip
data.value: Sets the camera to high gain mode. This gain mode has less read noise compared to low gain and it is advised for most cams to activate always, except when you want to use the lowest possible gain with the highest dynamic range.

data.name: LblRelativeFocuserNotSupported
data.value: Focusers without the capability to use absolute positions are currently not supported

data.name: LblQhyIncludeOverscanTooltip
data.value: Setting to On will the include any optical black and overscan areas of the sensor in images

data.name: LblAbout
data.comment: Header of about section for general info for N.I.N.A.

data.name: LblASCOMPlatformOutdated
data.value: ASCOM Platform Version is outdated. Please update to the latest ASCOM platform version. Otherwise the application might not be able to connect to all ASCOM devices.

data.name: LblDomeAzimuthToleranceDegreesTooltip
data.value: The dome slews if the target azimuth is off by more than this amount

data.name: LblDomeGemAxisLengthTooltip
data.value: If Alt/Az, this should be 0. For an EQ mount, slew RA to +/- 90 degrees, and measure the lateral distance (in mm) from the axis to center of the telescope aperture

data.name: LblDomeLateralAxisLengthTooltip
data.value: In a side-by-side configuration, this is the distance (laterally, in mm) from the saddle to the OTA center. Positive is to the right when facing the celestial pole.

data.name: LblDomeRadiusTooltip
data.value: Measure from the center to the rim of the dome, along the base

data.name: LblDomeScopeEWTooltip
data.value: Measure the East or West offset (in mm) of the center of the mount from the center of the dome. Positive is to the right when facing the celestial pole.

data.name: LblDomeScopeNSTooltip
data.value: Measure the North or South offset (in mm) of the center of the mount from the center of the dome. Positive is towards the celestial pole.

data.name: LblDomeScopeUDTooltip
data.value: Measure the height difference (in mm) of the center of the mount axis relative to the base of the dome. For an Alt/Az mount, this is from the center of the Altitude axis, and for an EQ mount this is where the RA and DEC axes intersect. A positive number indicates the center of axis is higher than the base of the dome, and a negative number means it is lower.

data.name: LblSequenceContainsDarksAndLights
data.value: Camera has no mechanical shutter, no automated flat panel is connected and sequence contains DARK/BIAS items mixed in with LIGHT.

data.name: LblSequenceContainsDarksOnly
data.value: Camera has no mechanical shutter, no automated flat panel is connected and sequence only contains DARK/BIAS items. Make sure camera is covered.

data.name: LblDefaultGainTooltip
data.value: This value specifies the default gain that should be used whenever no gain was set explicitly

data.name: LblDefaultOffsetTooltip
data.value: This value specifies the default offset that should be used whenever no offset was set explicitly

data.name: LbLUsbLimitDescription
data.value: Camera USB speed or traffic limit setting

data.name: LblCameraTimeoutTooltip
data.value: The amount of time after exposure time until the image is considered as lost. When the camera does not send an image ready event after Exposure Time + Timeout the exposure will be cancelled.

data.name: LblMinIntensityTooltip
data.value: Guide star intensity is measured on a scale of 0-255. If intensity drops below this amount, then NINA will pause guiding until it returns. This may indicate the presence of clouds.

data.name: LblMetaGuideLowIntensityRestoreGuidingFailed
data.value: Failed to resume guiding after star intensity recovered

data.name: LblDomeFollowFailure
data.value: Dome synchronization error. No longer following telescope. {0}

data.name: LblCloseDomeShutterAtSequenceEnd
data.value: Close dome shutter at sequence end

data.name: LblDomeFindHomeBeforeParkTooltip
data.value: If FindHome is available, then this can improve the reliability of parking to the correct location, when a precise location is required.

data.name: LblAutoFocusTimeoutTooltip
data.value: Amount of time, in seconds, to wait for an auto focus during a sequence before cancelling to continue

data.name: LblMetaGuideLowIntensityStopGuiding
data.value: Stopped guiding due to low star intensity. There may be clouds.

data.name: LblDomeSyncTimeoutTooltip
data.value: The maximum amount of time, in seconds, to wait for the Dome and Telescope to synchronize their positions

data.name: LblMetaGuideDitherSettleTimeTooltip
data.value: Amount of time, in seconds, to wait for dithering to complete

data.name: LblCoordinatesToFramingTooltip
data.value: Send coordinates to the Framing Wizard

data.name: LblUltraModeTooltip
data.value: Enables the Ultra Mode for extra low read noise

data.name: LblRotatorReverseTooltip
data.value: Reverse movement direction of rotator. Toggle this, if the platesolver rotates into the wrong direction.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceCondition_LoopCondition_Description
data.value: A condition to loop a sequence container for the specified amount of loops

data.name: Lbl_SequenceCondition_TimeCondition_Description
data.value: A condition that loops until the specified time has been reached and then stops the current instruction set

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_DeepSkyObjectContainer_Description
data.value: Works like a sequential container, but a deep sky object can be specified which will auto populate all sub items with the relevant information (coordinates, rotation etc.)

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_ParallelContainer_Description
data.value: All items in this container are run in parallel. This container will not evaluate any conditions or triggers until all items are finished.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_SequentialContainer_Description
data.value: Runs all items in a sequential order. Trigger and conditions are evaluated after each item

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Camera_CoolCamera_Description
data.value: Cools down the camera for the given temperature and duration

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Camera_WarmCamera_Description
data.value: Warms the camera for the given duration

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_FilterWheel_SwitchFilter_Description
data.value: Moves the filter wheel to the specified filter

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_FlatDevice_CloseCover_Description
data.value: Closes the cover of the flat panel

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Focuser_MoveFocuserAbsolute_Description
data.value: Moves the focuser to the given absolute position

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Guider_Dither_Description
data.value: Sends a dither signal to the guider

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Imaging_TakeExposure_Description
data.value: Takes an exposure for the given duration, gain and offset

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Platesolving_CenterAndRotate_Description
data.value: Centers and rotates the telescope via plate solving and a rotator for the given coordinates and rotation

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Platesolving_Center_Description
data.value: Centers the telescope via plate solving for the given coordinates

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Telescope_ParkScope_Description
data.value: Parks the telescope to the park position

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Telescope_SlewScopeToAltAz_Description
data.value: Slews the telescope to the given altitude and azimuth coordinates

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Telescope_SlewScopeToRaDec_Description
data.value: Slews the telescope to the given right ascension and declination coordinates

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Telescope_SetTracking_Description
data.value: Sets the tracking mode on the mount

data.name: LblTrackingModeNotSupported
data.value: Tracking mode not supported by the mount

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Utility_Annotation_Description
data.value: A utility item to add annotations to a sequence

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Utility_ExternalScript_Description
data.value: Calls an external script for the given path

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Utility_MessageBox_Description
data.value: Opens up a message box with the provided text to be clicked. Can be used as a manual stop, e.g. to cover the scope for dark frames

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Utility_WaitForAltitude_Description
data.value: Waits until the altitude has been reached for the given coordinates

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Utility_WaitForTimeSpan_Description
data.value: Waits for a given duration in seconds

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Utility_WaitForTime_Description
data.value: Waits for the specified time in the hh:mm:ss format. Additionally a utility box is available to auto populate it for sunset, dusk, dawn and sunrise

data.name: Lbl_SequenceTrigger_AutofocusAfterHFRIncreaseTrigger_Description
data.value: A trigger to initiate an autofocus run after the HFR has increased by the given amount in percent since the last autofocus run or start of sequence

data.name: Lbl_SequenceTrigger_AutofocusAfterTemperatureChangeTrigger_Description
data.value: A trigger to initiate an autofocus run after the temperature has changed by the given amount in degrees since the last autofocus run or start of sequence

data.name: Lbl_SequenceTrigger_AutofocusAfterTimeTrigger_Description
data.value: A trigger to initiate an autofocus run after the time has passed by the given amount in minutes since the last autofocus run or start of sequence

data.name: Lbl_SequenceTrigger_MeridianFlipTrigger_Description
data.value: A trigger to initiate a meridian flip when conditions are met

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Validation_CameraCannotSetTemperature
data.value: Camera does not have a cooler and is unable to set a temperature

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Validation_FlatDeviceCannotOpenClose
data.value: The flat device does not support opening or closing the cover

data.name: Lbl_Sequencer_LoadSequence_Tooltip
data.value: Load complete sequence from JSON file

data.name: Lbl_Sequencer_RootElementMustBeRootContainer
data.value: Unable to load sequence - Sequencer root element must be sequence root container!

data.name: Lbl_Sequencer_SaveSequence_Tooltip
data.value: Save complete sequence to JSON file

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Switch_SetSwitchValue_Description
data.value: Sets a value for a given switch from the switch hub

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Validation_InvalidSwitchValue
data.value: Invalid value for selected switch! Minimum {0} / Maximum {1} / StepSize {2}

data.name: Lbl_SequenceTrigger_Guider_DitherAfterExposures_Description
data.value: Sends a dither command to the guider after the specified number of exposures

data.name: LblTemplate_DropTemplateHere
data.value: Drop Sequence Instruction Set from the Sequence here to create a new Template

data.name: LblTemplate_OverwriteTemplateMessageBox_Text
data.value: Template '{0}' already exists. Do you want to overwrite the existing Template? This action is irreversible.

data.name: LblTemplate_DeleteTemplateMessageBox_Text
data.value: Template '{0}' will be deleted. Do you want to delete the existing Template? This action is irreversible.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceTrigger_AutofocusAfterFilterChangeTrigger_Description
data.value: Starts AutoFocus after a detected filter change

data.name: Lbl_SequenceTrigger_AutofocusAfterExposures_Description
data.value: Triggers an autofocus run after the set amount of exposures have been captured

data.name: LblBuildSequenceTooltip
data.value: Builds up a sequence for the planned set of targets

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Imaging_TakeManyExposures_Description
data.value: Takes exposures for the given amount, duration, gain and offset. Triggers and conditions are evaluated in between the exposures.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Imaging_SmartExposure_Description
data.value: Takes exposures for the given amount, filter, duration, gain and offset and initiates a dither after the amount of exposures. Triggers and conditions are evaluated in between the exposures.

data.name: Lbl_Sequencer_SaveAsSequence_Tooltip
data.value: Save complete sequence to a new JSON file

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_FlatDevice_OpenCover_Description
data.value: Opens the cover of the flat panel

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_FlatDevice_SetBrightness_Description
data.value: Sets the brightness of the flat device to the specified value

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_FlatDevice_ToggleLight_Description
data.value: Toggles the flat device light on or off

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_FlatDevice_TrainedFlatExposure_Description
data.value: Looks up the trained exposure value for the specified parameters and takes flat exposures

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Validation_FlatDeviceTrainedExposureNotFound
data.value: No trained exposure value was found for the combination of filter {0}, gain {1}, binning {2}

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_SequenceRootContainer_TargetArea
data.value: Sequence Target Area Add Deep Sky Object Sequences here or add Targets via Sky Atlas or Framing Assistant

data.name: LblStartupSequenceTemplateTooltip
data.value: When set, this template will be pre-loaded into the sequencer.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Imaging_SmartExposure_DitherTooltip
data.value: Command a dither after the specified amount of exposures. A value of 0 will disable dither for this item.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_AddCondition_Tooltip
data.value: Add a loop condition to the instruction set. An instruction set will be executed and repeated when one or more conditions are added to a container as long as these loop conditions are truthy. Once one of the loop conditions are not truthy anymore, the execution of the remaining instructions inside the set will be skipped. Furthermore loop conditions are valid for the current instruction set and each sub set inside the set.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_AddInstruction_Tooltip
data.value: Add an instruction to the instruction set. An instruction is a single instruction or a set of instructions that will be executed, when they are valid. Instructions that are not valid (indicated by the red circled exclamation mark) will be skipped.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_AddTrigger_Tooltip
data.value: Add a trigger to the instruction set. Triggers are instructions, that are only executed when the specified parameters to execute them are met. Trigger parameters will be updated and evaluated after an instruction was completed. Furthermore triggers are valid for the current instruction set and each sub set inside the set.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_Delete_Tooltip
data.value: Removes the current instruction set and all its items from the sequence.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_MoveDown_Tooltip
data.value: Moves the instruction set and all its content down by one position. If the position below it is an instruction set that is expanded, it will be moved inside the instruction set. If the position below it is an instruction set that is not currently expanded, it will be moved below the instruction set.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_MoveUp_Tooltip
data.value: Moves the instruction set and all its content up by one position. If the position above it is an instruction set that is expanded, it will be moved inside the instruction set. If the position above it is an instruction set that is not currently expanded, it will be moved above the instruction set.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_Reset_Tooltip
data.value: Resets the state and progress of the current instruction set and all instructions that are inside.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Delete_Tooltip
data.value: Removes the current instruction from the instruction set.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_MoveDown_Tooltip
data.value: Moves the instruction down by one position. If the position below it is an instruction set that is expanded, it will be moved inside the instruction set. If the position below it is an instruction set that is not currently expanded, it will be moved below the instruction set.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_MoveUp_Tooltip
data.value: Moves the instruction up by one position. If the position above it is an instruction set that is expanded, it will be moved inside the instruction set. If the position above it is an instruction set that is not currently expanded, it will be moved above the instruction set.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Reset_Tooltip
data.value: Resets the state and progress of the current instruction.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Utility_WaitForAltitude_Progress
data.value: Waiting until target has reached specified altitude. {0}° / {1}°

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_Duplicate_Tooltip
data.value: Creates a duplicate of current set and all its items and append it to the parent instruction set

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Duplicate_Tooltip
data.value: Creates a duplicate of current item and append it to the parent instruction set

data.name: Lbl_OldSequencer_EmptyAreaDescription
data.value: Add a new Sequence Target via the + Button, open an existing Target or add Targets via Framing Assistant

data.name: Lbl_SequenceCondition_AltitudeCondition_Description
data.value: A condition that loops while the target is above the given altitude and then stops the current instruction set

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Dome_CloseDomeShutter_Description
data.value: Closes the shutter of the dome

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Dome_ParkDome_Description
data.value: Parks the dome to the park position

data.name: LblOpenDomeShutterAtSequenceStart
data.value: Open dome shutter at sequence start

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Dome_OpenDomeShutter_Description
data.value: Opens the shutter of the dome

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Dome_EnableDomeSynchronization_Description
data.value: Ensures the dome remains synchronized with the telescope

data.name: Lbl_OldSequencer_HasSkippedRows
data.value: The Sequence contains rows which are either disabled or where the progress exposure count is equals to the total exposure count. These items are skipped and no items for these rows are generated for the sequencer.

data.name: LblSafetyMonitorConnectionLost
data.value: Safety Monitor connection has been lost!

data.name: Lbl_SequenceCondition_SafetyMonitorCondition_Description
data.value: A condition that checks the connected Safety Monitor device if it is safe and loops the instruction set as long as the safety monior reports to be safe. If the device returns to not be safe the current instruction set is stopped. Best used in conjunction with another loop condition to not end up in an infinite loop when the safety monitor stays true.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_SaveAsTemplate_Tooltip
data.value: Save the current instruction set and all of its content as a template for re-usage

data.name: Lbl_SequenceCondition_TimeSpanCondition_Description
data.value: Loop instruction set for a given duration. When the duration is over, the remaining instructions inside the set will be skipped.
